data.title: The outside of the Restaurant will make some people walk away
data.text:
Walking up to the front door, you start to wonder why does a restaurant owner want his customers to see dead plants, outdoor furniture that has seen better days, cigarette butts, peeling paint, etc..

It makes people say to themselves, Does the kitchen look like this?

The worse part is they have good food and good service, but i have to say I don't feel like i will return.

Sitting the restaurant the other day my wife and i are looking out the window and there is a chain link fence, with a dog barking, more dead plants...

I hope the owner reads this review and spends a few bucks to make his place appealing.

data.title: The absolute best
data.text: Bann Thai is family owned and run. The service is prompt. The food is the best. Love the lunch offerings. Not too much, but just enough for a delicious and satisfying meal.

data.title: Delightful, authentic and economical
data.text:
I worked in Thailand for three years and miss the great flavors originating there.  Bann Thai takes my taste back to Bangkok every time I visit.

The cooks are Thai and the meals they prepare are as authentic as one can get here in the states.

My full-belly endorsement.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: My daughter recommended this place and it was well worth it. Lots of choices and great food. Best Orange Chicken I have ever had. Does take out.

data.title: Little old house, great food and service
data.text: Having been born and lived in Thailand, I can say that this is a great place to eat Thai food in Riverside. Have been there twice for lunch so far, and will be back. Delicious, and vegetarian options available on most dishes. The building itself is a little old house, but that makes it cozy and great for a lunchtime conversation with a friend. The server was great--friendly, chatty, and helpful. Bonus: Close to Riverside Plaza, so you can get some good shopping or a trip to the movies in with your stop at this restaurant.

data.title: A very average Thai restaurant
data.text: The food is not bad, but it is nothing special either; it is just a very average thai restaurant. We have been a lot of times and I still can't think of anything at all memorable about it.

data.title: Great Thai food small neighborhood  restaurant
data.text:
Great small family restaurant good for locals or people visiting  Riverside. It is very close to the Riverside Plaza. Just a 2  blocks north where central ave, magnolia ave and Brockton ave intersect, on Brockton ave . The place itself is not much. Old small house, but inside it is pretty cozy. Parking on the back Nothing fancy or luxurious , but service is good and food is great. Ambiance is is good for a couple, family or causal business meal. It may not be able to hold a large group. Heard they have a second location by Mission inn. Can't wait to try it 

This place been there since I remember and have not been there for a while, and decided to go with the family, food remains delicious. All my fav Thai dishes are in the menu. 
Like any other Thai place, how hot it comes it is difficult to control  so if u like spicy ask for 5-6. If it is comes hot is not super hot
I love the Tom Kha  soup, they make it perfect. Green  curry is delicious, I recommend it. Noodles favorites are radna. Try the the pad kee Mao if you like spicy
One fav and a must try is the pineapple fried rice.  The. You have your most popular entrees in this place and all are good
For dessert if they have it, try the sticky rice with mango.  It is delicious or the fried bananas with ice cream
This Thai restaurant is really good if you live in the area or just visiting this is a good neighborhood restaurant

data.title: AUTHENTIC THAI FOOD IN RIVERSIDE
data.text: Three of us had business in Riverside one day last week and decided on Thai food for lunch.  We found Bann Thai online and decided to give it a try.  The verdict was unanimous……we added it to our ‘regular’ list.  Inside, the place just shouts ‘authentic.’  Our server was extremely pleasant and the service was excellent.  If your dish is spicy, you can choose the degree of hotness from 1 to 10.  I had red curry with pork and chose a spicy level of 7.  It was perfect and I can’t wait to return and introduce more friends to Bann Thai.

data.title: Very Surprised by a Little Hole in the Wall Thai restaurant
data.text:
My wife and I ended up at this place because the restaurant we always go to was closed for vacation.

We were in the parking lot and saw the sign and said, well let's give it a try.

It's located in an old house, it's not much to look at from the outside, but we were surprised at how nice is was inside.

Nothing fancy, just a nice cozy place, it was packed with people, but were lucky and were seated right away.

Nice friendly people, good service, and very reasonable.

My wife and I are big curry fans, and we loved what we ordered, they had a large menu and we went with the chicken in curry dish which was great.

We will surely come back..

data.title: My Go-To Thai Place
data.text: The Tom Kha (coconut milk soup) and Tom Yum (hot and sour soup) are both amazing and the cup is a good-sized portion. The Pad See Ewe is a personal favorite because the sauce is to die for. I've had many entrees and have never been disappointed. I highly recommend! And they just opened a new location off of Mission Inn and the 91.

data.title: Casual, delicious!
data.text: We really enjoyed our first visit.  Casual friendly place.  Excellent service. Very good food, tasty and fresh.  We started with a crisp and lightly battered vegetable tempura.  I ordered the Chu Chee Chicken curry with thin threads of kaffir lime leaves garnishing a rich, spicy, sweet coconut milk broth.  The chicken was tender and flavorful -- served with steamed rice.  My husband enjoyed his Pad Thai very much.  Two beers each made for a nice afternoon away from home.  We will be back!

data.title: Yellow Curry is mouth watering
data.text: We love Bann Thai, the service is always great even when they are packed (and that is often). We are working our way down the entire menu except for the double chili dishes because our heat meter is on the low side. My favorite is the yellow curry which is literally mouth watering. I had lunch at their new downtown Riverside location and it was just as good. New location is much bigger and will accommodate large groups and has a patio. I look forward to many happy meals at both locales!

data.title: I love Thai food
data.text: Our family has been going here since they opened their doors. A great Neighborhood find. Food is always fresh and delicious. Congratulations to the Arch family on opening their second location. Also in Riverside, but closer to Downtown.  Can't wait to try it.

data.title: Best Thai Food in the Neighborhood
data.text: Bann Thai is my hometown, neighborhood, favorite, "go to" place.  I come here all the time for date night with my wife, for dinners with friends, and for business meetings. The staff are so friendly and so helpful in navigating the big and extensive menu common to many family Thai restaurants.  It is family owned, and the portions are plentiful and flavorful.  They can be a little inconsistent on their level of spiciness, on a heat scale of 1 (mild) to 10 (very hot).  One day, a curry dished ordered at a spicy/heat scale of 7 is tame, the next time, the same dish ordered as a 7 is like eating liquid uranium.  Now since I prefer my Thai food to be as hot and spicy as liquid uranium, this tends to work out in my favor.  If it is too mild (as in not melting the cutlery), I just add various spices that the staff make available (Anaheim peppers in fish sauce; red chili sauce, and jalapeno rings), until it reaches the spicy heat I love.  It's never been "too hot". Great prices. Friendly service. Tasty food. Within walking and bicycling distance of my house.  You just can't beat it.  A great little place.  My favorite restaurant. Period.

data.title: Best Thai place in town!
data.text: What a great family owned restaurant. People are nice the food is great and the atmosphere is cozy.  Great spice, great flavor. I have never had anything bad from this menu.

data.title: Enter As Strangers, Leave As Friends
data.text:
The title here is seen on a sign behind the hostess desk as you enter the restaurant.  Truer words are hard to find.  This is a cozy, intimate restaurant with outstanding service and exquisite food.  
Our party of four arrived a bit early for our 8 pm reservation but that presented no problem for the staff.  Despite all of us having been here before and being familiar with the generous portions, we ordered enough not only for dinner, but also some to go for lunch the next day.  We started with a split appetizer of both fried and steamed pot stickers, which again presented no problem for the staff.  Our dinner, which we shared family style, consisted of yellow curry, chicken pad thai, sweet and sour pork, and beef gra pow.  The yellow curry was presented just enough in advance of the rest of the dinner that we were almost finished with it when the rest arrived.  Everything was delivered hot and you could tell the ingredients were very fresh.  
Two side notes here:  1) When ordering, you will be offered a choice of spiciness on many items on a scale of 1 to 10.  Be careful, as most people will find 4 either as spicy as they want, or perhaps too much so.  2) Sam, the owner, informs me that a second location is in the works with an anticipated opening date in August.  It, also, will be located in Riverside.
WARNING:  After a few visits here, you will enter as friends and leave as family.

data.title: Delicious Thai Food
data.text: The food was very enjoyable and very fresh. The prices were very reasonable, and the staff was very pleasant.

data.title: Wow, I still think about the meal.
data.text: This was my first time to this place.  The four of us ordered different dishes to share and they were all good.  Even the vegetarian in the group separated the beef/chicken/fish from the dishes to enjoy the noodles and vegetables.  Great service, good food, and happy customers all around us.  I am looking forward to my next visit there.

data.title: VERY GOOD TAI FOOD
data.text: Bann Tai is located in an old home converted to a restaurant.  The menu is very large and has a variety of special dishes and combinations.  The food is excellent and the service is very good.  Very tasty and not over filling.

data.title: Pineapple fried rice (with Shimps)
data.text: This is a family owner restaurant, they are very kind with customers, but the best is when you get your order: the food is so yummi. I love it!
